profile_positions.company: SITIE - IMPIANTI INDUSTRIALI S.P.A. for Yara Sluiskil
profile_positions.description:
Opened in 1929, the Yara Sluiskil site is located on the Ghent-Terneuzen canal, a major waterway opening into the North Sea and connecting to European waterways. As with many European fertilizer complexes, development of the site was linked to the availability of coke oven gas from a neighboring coke factory. Today, Yara Sluiskil uses mostly North Sea gas to produce quality nitrogen fertilizers and industrial chemicals. SITIE is an International company that works in the field of electrical and instrumentation installations, from the design up to commissiong and start-up of the plants.
As an HSE Inspector at SITIE for Yara I have to :
- Monitor and enforce PPE compliance with site employees and escalates issues as required
- Perform the daily formal HSE work site inspection 
- Develop and assist line management in conducting a Worker HSE Orientation Program
- Assist with the development of safe work practices and job hazard analyses for staffs
- Conduct and documents project health, safety, and environment inspections and submits to the project management team and HSE manager
- Advise project HSE manager promptly of the occurrence of any significant health, safety, or environment incidents
- Assist and/or leads project team in investigation/documentation of incidents
- Assess the project’s training requirements and conducts safety training as required. In some cases the HSE supervisor will be required to assess and evaluate third party training providers.
- Audit sub contractor safety programs to ensure compliance with local legislation.
- Monitor sub trade safety performance (sub trade safe work practices and job hazard analysis)
- Provide information to project staff on applicable health, safety and environment legislation requirements.

profile_positions.company: NIDAB Produktion / DAMEN SHIPREPAIR DUNKERQUE REFURBISHMENT FLOATING DOCK PROJECT
profile_positions.description:
Damen Shiprepair Dunkerque was assigned the task of renovating the floor of its floating dock, Dock III. Following four months of studies and preparation by a dedicated team of ten technicians, 170 people worked night and day to cut out and remove the old floor, prefabricate and install the new structure and finally apply an anti-corrosion treatment to guarantee optimum protection of the new construction.
Job duties was :
 - Controls the provision of a safe and hygienic work environment for all Nidab Produktion AB Company and contractor personnel in the operated shipyard , Damen Shiprepair Dunkerque, part of Damen Shipyards Group. Scope includes oversight and monitoring for the implementation of the companies safety procedures; audits of work practices in assigned areas, Permit To Work system; investigation and assist HSE Manager on all matters related to incidents and development of appropriate recommendations to prevent future recurrence. 
- Coordinate with HSE officers during the inspecting and auditing of the comapnies safety programs for the ship construction/repair facility. 
- Identifies and elevates unsafe work practices throughout the work sites, develops and recommends improvements and ensures proper implementation.
- Support development, implementation, monitoring, verification, and improvement of HSE Plan.
- Participate in periodic updates of HSE Plan
- Assess the HSE orientation program for promoting an incident, injury free workplace and supervising specific emergency drills for personnel in assigned area and assesses program effectiveness.
- Ensure that safety equipment and facilities are kept in best working condition by monitoring preventive maintenance program and setup an efficient record keeping system.
- Oversee the implementation of the Permit To Work system,includes reviewing permits and JSA.
- Ensure assigned areas are safe for required work through work sites inspections, especially during dangerous or potentially difficult work.
